install.name: Editor - WysiwygPro 3
install.author: Chris Bolt
install.description: WysiwygPro Installation Step Four Complete. If you have not installed the component please now install Component.zip.

param.name: lang
param.label: Language Pack
param.description: New language packs should be uploaded to /mambots/editors/wysiwygPro3/wysiwygPro/lang/

param.name: theme
param.label: Theme
param.description: New themes should be uploaded to /mambots/editors/wysiwygPro3/wysiwygPro/themes/

param.name: fixedWidth
param.label: Width
param.description: If you would like to set the width of the editor then enter it here. Values may either be a percentage such as 100% or a fixed width such as 600

param.name: htmlVersion
param.label: HTML Output
param.description: The HTML specification that generated HTML should conform to.

param.name: lineReturns
param.label: Line Returns
param.description: Whether to use P tags or DIV tags when you press enter.

param.name: urlFormat
param.label: URL Schema
param.description: Sets the format of URLs. Include domain name is a good choice if content is to be delivered via email. Do not include domain name is a good choice if you use SEF URLs and would like the ability to move the site to another domain. Relative is a great choice for development environments but could cause problems if you use SEF URLs.

param.name: escapeCharacters
param.label: Escape Special Characters
param.description: Whether to escape special characters.

param.name: stylesheet
param.label: Stylesheet URL
param.description: The URL of the stylesheet you want WysiwygPro to use to render HTML. Leave blank for automatic detection of your default template stylesheet.

param.name: colors
param.label: Color Swatches
param.description: A comma separated list of custom color swatches to appear on the color picker. Example: #fffff2, #f2f2f2

param.name: styles
param.label: Styles
param.description: WysiwygPro styles for the styles menu. Leave blank for the default set. The format is a friendly name for your style followed by a single colon : followed by the tag and any attributes. Example: Normal:p, Heading 1:h1, Heading 2:h2, Heading 3:h3, My Class:span class="myClass", Image Class:img class="myImageClass"

param.name: fonts
param.label: Fonts
param.description: A semi-colon separated list of fonts for the font menu. Leave blank for the default set. This list is semi-colon separated so that you can use a comma to separate alternative fonts. Example: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; Webdings

param.name: sizes
param.label: Font Sizes
param.description: A comma separated list of font sizes (numbers from 1-7 or in XHTML 1.1 mode specify pixel sizes) for the font size menu. Leave blank for the default set. Example: 1, 2, 3, 4

param.name: content_links
param.label: Content Links
param.description: Enable the WysiwygPro article browser for easy creation of links to content items. (Requires the WysiwygPro 3 component)

param.name: image_manager
param.label: Image Manager
param.description: Enable shared image management.

param.name: image_thumbnails
param.label: Image Thumbnails
param.description: If the Image Manager is enabled this allows you to enable or disable image thumbnail generation.

param.name: image_folder
param.label: Store images in
param.description: If the image manager is enabled then images will be stored in this folder. Make sure this folder exists and is writable by your server.

param.name: imageDiskQuota
param.label: Disk Quota
param.description: Disk quota for the images folder.

param.label: Document Manager
param.description: Whether to enable the shared document manager for linking to PDF files and other downloads.
param.name: document_manager
document_folder
param.label: Store documents in
param.description: If the document manager is enabled then documents will be stored in this folder. Make sure this folder exists and is writable by your server.

param.name: documentDiskQuota
param.label: Disk Quota
param.description: Disk quota for the documents folder.

param.label: Media Manager
param.description: Whether to enable the shared media manager for inserting Flash, QuickTime and other media files.
param.name: media_manager
media_folder
param.label: Store media in
param.description: If the media manager is enabled then media files will be stored in this folder. Make sure this folder exists and is writable by your server.

param.name: mediaDiskQuota
param.label: Disk Quota
param.description: Disk quota for the media folder.

param.label: Embed Media Using JavaScript
param.description: Whether to embed media files using JavaScript. Enabling this option will remove the Click to Activate message in Internet Explorer.
param.name: JSEmbed
publisher_permissions
param.label: Publisher Permissions
param.description: If any of the file managers are enabled this sets file permissions for Publishers.

param.name: editor_permissions
param.label: Editor Permissions
param.description: If any of the file managers are enabled this sets file permissions for Editors.

param.name: author_permissions
param.label: Author Permissions
param.description: If any of the file managers are enabled this sets file permissions for Authors.

param.name: registered_permissions
param.label: Registered Permissions
param.description: If any of the file managers are enabled this sets file permissions for Registered Users.

param.name: anonymous_permissions
param.label: Anonymous Permissions
param.description: If any of the file managers are enabled this sets file permissions for Anonymous Users (user that are not logged in).

param.label: User Folders
param.description: Whether to enable folders for each user.
param.name: user_folders
user_folder
param.label: Store user folders in
param.description: If user folders is enabled then each user folder will be created within this directory. This folder must NOT be within any of the above folders. Make sure this folder exists and is writable by your server.

param.name: userDiskQuota
param.label: Disk Quota
param.description: Disk quota for user folders.

param.label: Allow Registered Users
param.description: Whether to allow registered users to have a user folder.
param.name: user_folders_allow_registered
allowedImageExtensions
param.label: Allowed Image Types
param.description: Image file types that are allowed for upload, separate with a comma.

param.name: maxImageSize
param.label: Max Image Size
param.description: The maximum allowed size of uploaded images. Most servers do not allow uploads larger than 2 MB.

param.name: maxImageWidth
param.label: Max Image Width
param.description: The maximum allowed width of uploaded images specified in pixels.

param.name: maxImageHeight
param.label: Max Image Height
param.description: The maximum allowed height of uploaded images specified in pixels.

param.name: allowedDocExtensions
param.label: Allowed Document Types
param.description: Document file types that are allowed for upload, separate with a comma.

param.name: maxDocSize
param.label: Max Document Size
param.description: The maximum allowed size of uploaded documents. Most servers do not allow uploads larger than 2 MB.

param.name: allowedMediaExtensions
param.label: Allowed Media Types
param.description: Media file types that are allowed for upload, separate with a comma.

param.name: maxMediaSize
param.label: Max Media Size
param.description: The maximum allowed size of uploaded media files. Most servers do not allow uploads larger than 2 MB.

param.name: fileCHMOD
param.label: CHMOD New Files to
param.description: If you need specific permissions set on files uploaded by the WysiwygPro file managers you may set them here, or leave blank to use the server defaults. Settings must be prefixed with a 0 e.g. 0666

param.name: folderCHMOD
param.label: CHMOD New Folders to
param.description: If you need specific permissions set on folders created by the WysiwygPro file managers you may set them here, or leave blank to use the server defaults. Settings must be prefixed with a 0 e.g. 0777

param.name: snippet1_html
param.label: Snippet 1 HTML
param.description: A snippet of HTML code which you use often so would like available on the Insert a Snippet tool.

param.name: snippet1_label
param.label: Snippet 1 Label
param.description: Label for Snippet 1 so that you can quickly identify it.

param.name: snippet2_html
param.label: Snippet 2 HTML
param.description: A snippet of HTML code which you use often and would like available on the Insert a Snippet tool.

param.name: snippet2_label
param.label: Snippet 2 Label
param.description: Label for Snippet 2 so that you can quickly identify it.

param.name: snippet3_html
param.label: Snippet 3 HTML
param.description: A snippet of HTML code which you use often and would like available on the Insert a Snippet tool.

param.name: snippet3_label
param.label: Snippet 3 Label
param.description: Label for Snippet 3 so that you can quickly identify it.

param.name: snippet4_html
param.label: Snippet 4 HTML
param.description: A snippet of HTML code which you use often and would like available on the Insert a Snippet tool.

param.name: snippet4_label
param.label: Snippet 4 Label
param.description: Label for Snippet 4 so that you can quickly identify it.

param.name: snippet5_html
param.label: Snippet 5 HTML
param.description: A snippet of HTML code which you use often and would like available on the Insert a Snippet tool.

param.name: snippet5_label
param.label: Snippet 5 Label
param.description: Label for Snippet 5 so that you can quickly identify it.

param.name: toolbarLayout
param.label: Toolbar Layout
param.description: Whether to use a custom layout or the default layout. If you choose a custom layout then the toolbars defined below will replace the default toolbars. If you choose the default layout then the toolbars below will be displayed beneath the default toolbars.

param.name: toolbar1
param.label: Custom layout toolbar 1
param.description: A comma separated list of buttons to appear on toolbar 1. See http://www.wysiwygpro.com/index.php?id=143 for available buttons.

param.name: toolbar2
param.label: Custom layout toolbar 2
param.description: A comma separated list of buttons to appear on toolbar 2. See http://www.wysiwygpro.com/index.php?id=143 for available buttons.

param.name: toolbar3
param.label: Custom layout toolbar 3
param.description: A comma separated list of buttons to appear on toolbar 3. See http://www.wysiwygpro.com/index.php?id=143 for available buttons.

param.name: enableFeatures
param.label: Enable Features
param.description: A comma separated list of features to enable. See http://www.wysiwygpro.com/index.php?id=143 for available features.

param.name: disableFeatures
param.label: Disable Features
param.description: A comma separated list of features to disable. See http://www.wysiwygpro.com/index.php?id=143 for available features.

param.name: loadPlugins
param.label: Load Plugins
param.description: A comma separated list of plugins to load. Enter 'null' to load no plugins.
